hook_patterns.example: I talk more than I type. Always have.
I wore an Oura Ring for months. Then I stopped.
Most teams think Duolingo won because of gamification. That's not what I saw.
Kids, grandparents, and strangers singing together. No introductions needed.
Todoist is one of the most popular task managers in the world. I barely use any of its features.

structure.body_structure: numbered insights with examples and analysis

tone_markers.description: Heavy use of 'I' for personal experience, 'you' for direct address, minimal 'we'
examples: So here's my question for you
What friction is hiding in your product

tone_markers.description: Mix of short punchy statements and longer analytical sentences
examples: This isn't accident. It's behavioral architecture.
The insight: Most products reward 'best content.' Winners reward 'showing up.'

tone_markers.description: Frequent em-dashes, arrows (→), and strategic line breaks for emphasis
examples: What Vietnam understands about belonging that product teams don't →

tone_markers.description: Accessible but precise language, avoids jargon while being analytical
Frequent use of parallel structure and contrast patterns
examples: Traditional community asks you to: ❌ / Karaoke removes all of that: ✓

repeated_phrases: Here's what [company] figured out that most [category] haven't
Most teams would [do obvious thing]. I'd [ask deeper question]
voice_fingerprints.overall_tone: analytical observer who challenges conventional wisdom through personal experience and behavioral insight
voice_fingerprints.distinctiveness: Combines first-person narrative with systems thinking, uses personal usage patterns as data points to reveal broader behavioral principles, consistently reframes surface metrics to expose underlying dynamics
